page.title: 04THE BLIND HOUSE.
page.content: The Blind House is situated beside the River Till and the A360. The building is an ancient monument dating back to the eighteenth century. It is a small circular building with a domed roof and made of stone. The Blind House has two small windows with iron bars, and a heavy wooden door with an iron handle and hinges. The Blind House was a lock-up where village criminals were gaoled temporarily before being either released or hung at the Gibbet. The lock-up was in use up until the end of the nineteenth century. Because of its position, on dangerous road junction the Blind House has been moved twice,but its original appearance has been maintained.
